meanings.definition: In a trustworthy or consistent manner.
meanings.sent1: She always completes her tasks reliably.
meanings.sent2: The clock reliably chimes every hour.
meanings.sent3: The robot reliably followed its programming, even dancing on command.
meanings.sent4: The old car reliably chugged along like a faithful horse.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon shone reliably through the stormy night.

meanings.definition: In a way that can be depended on.
meanings.sent1: The mail carrier reliably delivers letters to our door.
meanings.sent2: The sun rises reliably in the east every morning.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast was so reliably wrong that we brought umbrellas on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reliably brightened even the gloomiest days.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle pointed reliably north, guiding us through the dense forest.
